meanings.definition: To surpass in cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outwile her opponent by coming up with a clever plan.
meanings.sent2: The detective managed to outwile the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The fox thought he could outwile the farmer, but he ended up getting caught in the trap.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking allowed her to outwile the tricky situation and come out on top.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, you must outwile your opponent to win.

meanings.definition: To outsmart or outmaneuver someone through cleverness or trickery.
meanings.sent1: He was able to outwile his classmates in the math competition.
meanings.sent2: The magician used his skills to outwile the audience and leave them amazed.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tried to outwile the campers by stealing their food when they weren't looking.
meanings.sent4: She managed to outwile her competitors in the business world and become successful.
meanings.sent5: To outwile your opponents in a debate, you must think quickly and stay one step ahead.
